p: Vasicinol is a quinazoline alkaloid from Adhatoda zeylanica Medic. [ 117]. Crude endophyte extracts of Bacillus safensis, Pseudomonas cichorii, and Arthrobacter pascens displayed the presence of this alkaloid; this is not surprising as some quinazoline alkaloids are produced by microbes [ 118]. Vasicinol can be tested on other resistant pathogenic bacteria to combat antimicrobial resistance, as its antibacterial activity has been reported by Jain et al. [ 99].
